intro: Ardisia waitakii, commonly known as the Waitakere ardisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are an important food source for native birds. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its leaves are glossy and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
